data.title: Great local shop
data.text: I came here with my boyfriend after an afternoon of walking around old town. The two ladies running the shop were closing down for the day. They were kind enough to squeeze us in before closing. Not a big place but nice outdoor seating. Great, friendly service. The coffee is delicious. Definitely worth stopping in for a drink!

data.title: My go-to coffee shop
data.text: This little gem is hidden in the alley of Old Glendale.  The coffee is made one cup at a time, so it takes a little longer, but it's worth the wait.  I love sitting at a table outside in the alleyway when the weather's nice.  Friendly staff and great coffee.  If you like your coffee fresh, this is your coffee shop!

data.title: Funky coffee house
data.text: We search out funky coffee houses and restaurants and this one certainly qualifies.  As other reviews stated, this one's tucked away in an alley but is conveniently located close to the park at the center of the city and its library and visitors' center.  Coffee was excellent and the breakfast sandwiches were made from scratch -- just like at home.  I would return if I had a chance.

data.title: Unexpected pleasure in Glendale
data.text:
We happened to be in the area and went online to find a good coffee spot. Not being from Arizona, it took a bit of looking to find this cute little coffee shop tucked away. It was a Saturday morning when we visited. There were no other customers and no music when we walked in. The young man behind the counter was friendly although he wasn't sure about the pastry selections that appeared leftover and not so fresh. The place was quiet and kitschy--I wasn't holding out too much hope that the latte was going to be the greatest.

Surprise! The lattes my husband and I had were very good. As we sat, a few other customers came and went. We bravely tried a piece of the unidentified cake and also found it moist and tasty. And soon the barista got the music going. We ended up having a really enjoyable coffee break in Glendale, thanks to Shot of Java.

data.title: Cosy
data.text: This place is tucked away, a little off Glendale ave. Very comfortable, very friendly. The owner seems to know all the regulars by name. Could use a bit more variety on pastries. But the coffee is very good.

data.title: Perfect cup of joe!
data.text: Best coffee in Arizona! The owner is such a sweet lady who remembers her customers. I come here every week now.

data.title: Best Shots of Java around!
data.text: This place has a homey atmosphere with Lisa as your hostess. I have to stop here every time I go to Glendale! The Mocha Coconut is THE BEST!! I can't seem to order anything else!! Lisa is an awesome hostess and welcomes you as a friend that just came to her house for a visit! Love the coziness of this place and will definitely be going back for more!! Drop by for a Shot of Java or two  and you won't go wrong at this place!!

data.title: Mexican Hot Chocolate
data.text: I love stopping here for the Mexican Hot Chocolate.  Ladies are so friendly and hot chocolate is fabulous, be sure and get the whip cream with it, you won't be sorry.

data.title: Get the Mayan Mocha!
data.text:
What a cute little place! The atmosphere is chill and comfortable (not pretentious). The wifi is free (for paying customers). The service was very friendly. The coffee was DELICIOUS! We ordered a 16oz Triple Shot of Espresso Mayan Mocha and it was unique. Slight hint of cinnamon among chocolate and the best part, coffee! We appreciate any place that has some sort of unique coffee to try and my husband claims the coffee to be reminicent of the coffee he tried in Peru (compliment). 

Side note: They have open mic nights on Thursdays so come out and support this little shop and flex your golden pipes.

data.title: Awesome and Relaxing!
data.text: The best coffee shop I have visited. Very relaxing atmosphere and the ladies working are great and helpful. A frequent stop in my weekly routines.

data.title: An Indie coffee Oasis in Downtown Glendale
data.text: A local sent me to this friendly coffee spot and I am grateful. I had a lovely espresso con panna and a biscotti but they also serve teas, smoothies, and lots of other drinks hot and cold. Open late, featuring regularly scheduled poetry readings and wifi, this little spot is filled with personality. Good coffee & indie spirit made me wish I lived nearby.

data.title: Great place for a hot drink
data.text: wonderful coffee house tucked away. Wide variety of fresh brewed coffee, tea, and incredible hot chocolate. I had the hazelnut hot chocolate, it was to die for. A wonderful find! Something for everyone and affordable.

data.title: Tucked Away Gem
data.text:
We found this little place online, looking for coffee in the area, but never knew that it was there. It's tucked away in the alley behind a mexican restaurant on the main drag and you'll find it by the crowd outside. It's a small, small shop that holds maybe 6 people comfortably. The signs hanging up are very funny and there's plenty of stuff to look at and read while your'e there. When the orders get backed up, you're all basically standing on top of each other, grabbing your coffee when it's called and bobbing and weaving your way out.

The mexican hot chocolate is amazing. The coffee is great. The only issue was the temperature. It's a little cooler than hot, which makes it easy to drink right away, but it's not hot enough to warm you up. Even with that considered, we will be back. Now that we know it's there.
